channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2024021535
item.description:
Report X-2024021535

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found damaged wet on the bottom of package. The package was placed in a red bin by QA and transported to the hazmat area to be processed properly. DescribePack: The bottle of acid was found in a plastic bag with some strap on the cap. The bottle leaked a little in the bag and it deteriorate wetting up the box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in red bin and brought to hazmat cage to be processed properly.

item.title: Report X-2024020934
item.description:
Report X-2024020934

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Management found leaking hazmat package sitting on floor of truck. Box was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: After inspecting box, there was 1 can missing a top causing liquid to spill out into box. There was no inner packing materials to keep items from damaging. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed into a red hazardous tote; and moved to hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020740
item.description:
Report X-2024020740

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: On 1/27/24 Box came out of trailer in unload leaking and wet. Box was taken to QA area for processing. Box was placed inside a blue hazmat bag and placed inside a tote then taken to Hazmat cage and left outside Hazmat cage. Box sat by hazmat cage until 1/30/24. Box was taken to QA for processing. Box was placed into red hazmat tote and processed accordingly. DescribePack: Upon inspection discovered the cap on bottle was loose and 1 pint of liquid leaked out into box and onto container. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: On 1/27/24 box came out of trailer in unload leaking and wet. Box was brought to QA area for processing. Box was placed inside blue hazmat bag then placed in tote, and placed by hazmat cage. On 1/30/24 box was processed and placed inside hazmat drum for storage.

item.title: Report X-2024020648
item.description:
Report X-2024020648

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer by the package handlers. They called for QA to inspect the box. After seeing the damage QA got a red tote and transported package to the hazmat area to be process properly. DescribePack: The package was damage from the bottom of the box, with loose caps on the bottles. The bottles were packed inside of another package. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in red tote and immediately transported to the hazmat area.
